articles.content:
Nomination of Candidates Closes 
    Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Electorate meetings for the nomination of candidates for deputies to the provincial (municipal,) city (district) and county people's assemblies of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea successfully closed at all constituencies across the country.
 Officials, workers, farmers and intellectuals who have devotedly worked for the party, the revolution, the country and the nation with a transparent revolutionary outlook on the leader and discharged their duties as befitting faithful servants of the people have been nominated as candidates for deputies to the provincial (municipal), city (district) and county people's assemblies.    
 The election committees at all constituencies across the country have registered them as candidates for deputies to the provincial (municipal), city (district) and county people's assemblies to be elected at their constituencies.

Plan for DPRK-Bangladesh Cultural Exchange Signed 
    Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- The 2003-2007 plan for cultural exchange between the governments of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and the People's Republic of Bangladesh was inked in Dhaka on July 27.
 The plan was signed by the DPRK ambassador and the secretary of the Bangladeshi Ministry of Culture on behalf of their governments.

articles.content:
Reception Given by Chinese Military Attache 
    Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Military attache of the Chinese embassy here Yan Jiangfeng hosted a reception at the embassy last evening on the occasion of the 76th anniversary of the founding of the Chinese People's Liberation Army.
 Present on invitation were Ryo Chun Sok, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, colonel general of the Korean People's Army Ri Pyong Sam and generals and officers, officials concerned and military attaches of foreign embassies here. 
 Chinese ambassador Wu Donghe and embassy officials were present.    
 Speeches were made at the reception.

FM of DPRK Greets His Swiss Counterpart 
    Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to Micheline Calmy-Rey, chief of the federal department of the Foreign Affairs of Switzerland, on the occasion of its National Day.
 Noting that her Pyongyang visit in May was greatly conducive to further developing the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, the message wished her success in her work.

articles.content:
Greetings to Swiss President
    Pyongyang, August 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Pascal Couchepin, President of Switzerland, today on the occasion of its National Day.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop favorably, the message wished him success in his work for prosperity of the country and welfare of the people.
